billEvents.eventText: referred to consumer affairs and protection

title: Provides that no issuer of a credit card shall send unsolicited, blank checks to a card member residing in New York state
summary: Provides that no issuer of a credit card shall send unsolicited, blank checks to a credit card member residing in New York state.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2181

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. REILICH -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Consumer Affairs and Protection

       AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to the unsolicited
         sending of blank checks by issuers of credit cards

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  520  of  the  general business law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 10 to read as follows:
    3    (10) NO ISSUER OF A CREDIT CARD SHALL SEND UNSOLICITED,  BLANK  CHECKS
    4  TO A CARD MEMBER RESIDING IN NEW YORK STATE.
    5    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
    6  have become a law.







        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03952-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to the unsolicited sending of blank checks by issuers of credit cards
